intro: Payena cambodiana, commonly known as Cambodian payena, is a tropical tree native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant produces small, red berries that are an important food source for various wildlife species. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in lowland evergreen forests. Due to habitat loss, Payena cambodiana is considered vulnerable in its native range.
